result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khalid Mhmood Shaker

defendant.name: Shaker, Khalid Mhmood

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Khalid Mhmood Shaker appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard appeared by video for Khalid Mhmood Shaker.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a DPA review hearing.  Defendant is completing conditions.  Case is adjourned to 1-30-23 at 8:30 am for a review hearing by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Review hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Khalid Mhmood Shaker in court with Attorney Brian Thomas Coe.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Deferred Agreement, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant was examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint.  Court approved the deferred agreement and WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction to allow the defendant time to comply.  

Case adjourned for a review hearing in Branch 10.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616.  Review hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Khalid Mhmood Shaker in court with Attorney Munjed Ahmad for Attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are requesting a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 7-19-22 at 2:30 pm for a DPAH.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Wavier of Rights, filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.
Early Intervention Program Domestic Violence Deferred Prosecution Agreement, filed.

Defendant Khalid Mhmood Shaker in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Khalid Mhmood Shaker appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel still needs offer and discovery and requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Court is in trial and unable to hear case.  Parties notified of new court date by email.  Case scheduled for Pretrial Conference on 5/25/2022 at 1:30 pm by zoom.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Y.S.A. (2/8/1989).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Khalid Mhmood Shaker in court with attorney Jeffrey J Guerard.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
